item.title: September 11 Quran Burning
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
Naw. I was just wondering.

I personally have no problem with people practicing their beliefs unless it means they get to become violent towards me and my family as a result of me practicing MY beliefs.

item.title: September 11 Quran Burning
item.dc:creator: Chrillen
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

I can practice my culture anywhere I want to? So I can go to some of these sandy countries and practice my Christianity in the streets without fear of death eh?

It is great that you have such a liberal and wonderful “live and let live” mentality, but it doesn’t work that way everywhere. But you knew that.

I’m just sayin.

So when some of “them” actually want to leave their “sandy countries”, so that they can practice their beliefs freely, in the USA for example, they should be sent back because you’re not allowed to practice your beliefs in their countries?

Or did you make that posts solely to point out that it isn’t possible for people to practice their beliefs everywhere?

Read full topic

item.title: September 11 Quran Burning
item.dc:creator: Fancy_Pants
item.description:
Seba:

Not taking any action is hardly an effort for destruction. I wonder if the only way for a decent life would be by attacking another country you would still say that it’s their right. And I didn’t understand the second sentence, but that just because I’m not so smart as you are :awesome:

uh… apparently. that sentence was fairly easy to understand. you might just be entirely stupid, but then again most racists, bigots, and self-admitted xenophobes are. you happen to fall under all three categories!
please tell me how they are attacking your country. they have every right to practice their culture ANYWHERE THEY WANT TO. if you don’t like it then don’t participate, you have absolutely no say in who is or isn’t “allowed” in a country THAT IS NOT EVEN YOURS.

Read full topic

item.title: September 11 Quran Burning
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Seba:
Your post just confirmed your lack of empathy and humanity.

And you “didn’t cause anything”? Your entire way of life (and mine, of course) is based on the exploitation of “third world countries”. If you don’t realize that, you should really take another look at the world, because you have no idea.

Read full topic

You

item.title: September 11 Quran Burning
item.dc:creator: Mr.Shadow
item.description:
Seba:

My culture is important to me. Why cannot you respect that?

I respect that, but I don’t respect the fact you think your culture is more important than human life.
[/QUOTE]
This MIGHT be a problem when they would tried to enforce a law that acts only the best for them and much worse for others.
[/QUOTE]
So you’re willing to sacrifice human life because of pure speculation?

Read full topic

item.title: September 11 Quran Burning
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
Seba:

I didn’t cause anything. Nor did millions of the citizens of my country. I don’t see a reason why we should somehow recompense for others’ sins.

This reeks so much of hypocrisy that I don’t even know where to start.

You say you shouldn’t recompense for others’ sins, but according to you every potential immigrant shouldn’t be able to enter your country because of what previous immigrants have done. DOUBLE STANDARDS FTW.

My culture is important to me. Why cannot you respect that?

That wasn’t the question. The question was “Why is your culture (or anybody’s, for that matter) more important than the lives of some people who aren’t born in your country?”

Also, way to ignore this:

Burbinator:
Seba:

Anyway, which “basic human rights” are you talking about? A right to migrate???

The right to nutrition, the right to shelter, the right to education, the right to safety, … I could go on.

Read full topic

item.title: September 11 Quran Burning
item.dc:creator: Seba
item.description:
Burbinator:

Empathy? Equality? Maybe you’re just too arrogant and self-involved to care about anyone else.

Helping others when you can become a victim in the process from the ones you have helped is a pure stupidity.

Burbinator:

Except that most poverty and political upheaval was and is caused by the Western world.

I didn’t cause anything. Nor did millions of the citizens of my country. I don’t see a reason why we should somehow recompense for others’ sins.

Burbinator:

No, but denying others the same thing out of sheer arrogance leans pretty damn close to racism.

You call it arrogance, I call it a will for self-preservation. I don’t feel I’m somehow better than them, so it’s not racism.

Burbinator:

Now you’re contradicting yourself. Before you said that paying taxes gives you the right to take action to have an influence on the society you live in.
I guess people who weren’t born there or whose parents weren’t born there are a special case? This reeks of bigotry.

No, I’m not contradicting myself. I said that immigrants WOULD have that right, so eventually they could change the law when they became numerous enough. I didn’t say they shouldn’t have that law, I said that this situation should be avoided.

Burbinator:

You obviously have no idea of what the world is like. I am 100% sure the vast majority of thefts in the world are for food and survival and not for luxury.

That’s why I said “in Europe”.

Burbinator:

The point is that the MAJORITY IS LIKE THAT.

How can you be some sure of that???

Burbinator:

And you know this how? I thought you had next to no experience with immigrants.

Because unfortunately not all people in my country are well-educated, and those who are are rarely aggressive.

Burbinator:

Migration was what started all this?
BTW, historically, territories involve the leaders of the territory, and not the people actually living on the territory.

Yes, but when people migrated they either were settling on an uninhabited land or had to “convince” local inhabitants that they should relocate.

Burbinator:

Oh and I just realized how silly this breaking up of posts is, so I’m going to stop doing it.

Suit yourself. BTW, this is the “peaceful coexistence” that you were talking about? -> immigrant riots? I cannot imagine something like that happening in my country. Immigration in France caused that a lot of poor suburbs have arisen which are a source of violence and aggression. And all of this could have been avoided…

Fancy Pants:

a right to make a decent life for themselves wherever they choose to. and funny you’d say that, seeing as you’re trying to destroy their culture by not wanting them to practice it just because it’s on a piece of land owned by the same people who own the piece of land you just HAPPENED to be born on.

Not taking any action is hardly an effort for destruction. I wonder if the only way for a decent life would be by attacking another country you would still say that it’s their right. And I didn’t understand the second sentence, but that just because I’m not so smart as you are :awesome:

Mr.Shadow:

Actually, yes, it is a little racist to think your culture (which is not a way to identify yourself, mind you) is more important than the lives of some people who aren’t born in your country. At least I think it is.

My culture is important to me. Why cannot you respect that?

Mr.Shadow:

First of all: SO WHAT? So they get to vote, why the fuck is that even a problem?

This MIGHT be a problem when they would tried to enforce a law that acts only the best for them and much worse for others.

X_Mastershot_X:

dickhead

Grow up.

Read full topic
